SweetLink Browser Demo

Click the button to request a SweetLink session. The demo calls /api/sweetlink/handshake, registers with the local daemon, and forwards console/command traffic so the CLI can attach. Once connected, try running the example commands below from the SweetLink CLI.

Make sure the SweetLink daemon is running (pnpm sweetlink:daemon) and that the mkcert certificate is trusted locally.

Screenshot Target

Use pnpm sweetlink screenshot demo --selector "#screenshot-card" to capture this card. The CLI scrolls the element into view and waits for ongoing animations.

Ready.

Try It

  1. Start the daemon: pnpm sweetlink:daemon
  2. Run the demo in another terminal: pnpm --filter @sweetlink/example-basic-web dev
  3. Open this page and click “Enable SweetLink”
  4. Attach the CLI: pnpm sweetlink console demo
  5. Run the sample commands above (run-js, screenshot, clicks)
